events.originalText: A magnitude-7.1 earthquake (damage pictured) struck the Canterbury Region of New Zealand, causing two deaths and up to NZ$40 billion in damages.
events.subtitle: 2010 Canterbury earthquake
events.headline: Magnitude-7.1 Earthquake Strikes Canterbury Region of New Zealand, Causing Two Deaths

events.originalText: Three terrorists suspected to be part of al-Qaeda were arrested in Germany after planning attacks on Frankfurt Airport and Ramstein Air Base.
events.subtitle: Al-Qaeda
events.headline: Three Suspected al-Qaeda Terrorists Arrested in Germany for Planning Attacks on Frankfurt Airport and Ramstein Air Base

events.originalText: The Golden Dragon massacre took place in Chinatown, San Francisco, leaving five dead and spurring police to end Chinese gang violence in the city.
events.subtitle: Golden Dragon massacre
events.headline: Golden Dragon Massacre Leaves Five Dead in San Francisco Chinatown

events.originalText: Governor Orval Faubus deployed the Arkansas National Guard to prevent nine African-American students from attending Little Rock Central High School.
events.subtitle: Orval Faubus
events.headline: Governor Orval Faubus Deploys Arkansas National Guard to Prevent African-American Students from Attending Little Rock Central High School

events.originalText: Evelyn Waugh's novel A Handful of Dust was first published in full.
events.subtitle: Evelyn Waugh
events.headline: Evelyn Waugh's Novel 'A Handful of Dust' Published in Full

events.originalText: The Albanian revolt ended when the Ottoman government agreed to meet most of the rebels' demands.
events.subtitle: Albanian revolt of 1912
events.headline: Albanian Revolt Ends as Ottoman Government Agrees to Rebels' Demands

events.originalText: After more than 25 years of fighting against the United States Army and the armed forces of Mexico, Geronimo of the Chiricahua Apache surrendered at Skeleton Canyon in Arizona.
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: Geronimo Surrenders to US Army and Mexican Armed Forces After 25 Years of Fighting

events.originalText: The state wedding of Teresa Cristina of the Two Sicilies and Emperor Pedro II of Brazil took place at the Cathedral of Rio de Janeiro.
events.subtitle: Teresa Cristina of the Two Sicilies
events.headline: State Wedding of Teresa Cristina of Two Sicilies and Emperor Pedro II of Brazil Held in Rio de Janeiro Cathedral

events.originalText: First Opium War: British vessels opened fire on Chinese war junks enforcing a food sales embargo on the British community on the Kowloon Peninsula.
events.subtitle: First Opium War
events.headline: First Opium War: British Vessels Open Fire on Chinese War Junks in Kowloon Peninsula

events.originalText: War of 1812: A coalition of Native American tribes began the siege of Fort Harrison in Terre Haute, Indiana, by setting the fort on fire.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: War of 1812: Native American Tribes Begin Siege of Fort Harrison in Terre Haute, Indiana

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: Facing starvation and a death rate of 100 soldiers per day, the French garrison in Malta surrendered to British forces, ending a two-year siege.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: French Garrison in Malta Surrenders to British Forces, Ending Two-Year Siege

events.originalText: Los Angeles was founded as El Pueblo de Nuestra Señora la Reina de los Ángeles by forty-four Spanish settlers.
events.subtitle: Los Angeles
events.headline: Los Angeles Founded by Spanish Settlers as El Pueblo de Nuestra Señora la Reina de los Ángeles

events.originalText: Germanic leader Odoacer captured Ravenna and deposed Emperor Romulus Augustus, marking the fall of the Western Roman Empire.
events.subtitle: Germanic peoples
events.headline: Germanic Leader Odoacer Captures Ravenna and Deposes Emperor Romulus Augustus, Marking Fall of Western Roman Empire
